author: BrickworldYT
title: Lego Tuk Tuk- Charming and Fun!
review:
Overview/Price

The new Lego Creator Tuk-Tuk is a beautiful set with a even better price. I could easily see Lego making this 15 or even 20 dollars, but 10 dollars for this is great. 

Pieces

In terms of pieces, there really isn't anything special. There are some nice colors and the little dangly bits on the roof are nice, but otherwise the parts are mediocre at best. 

Instructions

The instructions are surprisingly long, but not complex. The booklet does have some weight, however. 

Finished Model

The finished model is surprisingly big, but still works in a modular city. It fits at least 2 minifigures, one driver and one passenger. My only problem with the set is the lack of minifigures. As an Indian, I would have really liked some Indian-inspired minifigures, but even generic ones would be fine. 

Conclusion

In conclusion, this is a easy buy and I would definitely recommend it. It works great with the older speed champions and even Lego City cars, so it won't look out of place in a Lego City(at least a modular city). Hopefully, Lego makes more of these cheap vehicles, especially as Speed Champion sets increase in value over time.

author: Jmooresey
title: Tuk tuk me not long
review:
Being a fan of Lego since and early childhood, 70s, my wife and I have just started collecting the "adult" Lego, and wanted to have some extras to go with them.

My wife saw this and fell in love with it, next thing, one had landed on the doorstep and was ready to build.

At only £8.99, it's a steal, doesn't take long to build, has some great techniques for attaching parts and the colours and great.

The only criticism I have, is that it's not the right size for mini figs, just a touch too big.  But not that bad, as I got another one.

It makes it more interesting, with the different design and colours, of the more traditional cars and trucks.

More designs from different cultures.
